column3: Ok, maybe I incorrectly assume that I'm not alone with finding this ugly and distracting :)\n
I think we should just wait for the eventual clang-formattening; unless you really need that byte back.\n

I don't think a mass clang-format will happen. It's just too invasive
everywhere at the same time. It couls be done piecewise like the
-Woverwrite changes, but that's a simple thing and it takes a long time
already too.

My view is that whenever code is rewritten, we should try to bring it up to
par with coding style. But if people disagree that '> >' is something to
avoid, I will shut up a

# Benchmark

Forgot to include with initial PR, it's something like 12% faster in connect postprocess.

push -f'ed a version where txData type template extra whitespace is removed as per @sipa's request.

Travis might fail because I force pushed twice and there's a known race condition on that.
In c++11 the ugly '> >' (with a space in between) is no longer needed. Might as well fix it when you're changing it.\n
I mean at this point thats just like...coding style, right?\n
